content:
Here are corrected notes for your Greek mythology class in a quizlet/definition format:

• Pasiphae falls in love with a bull
• Minos becomes king of Crete, the Labyrinth is built to hold the Minotaur
• Death Ship - boarded by Theseus and 14 Athenian youths and maidens
• Black sails = dead, white sails = alive
• Ship lands in Crete, Theseus sentenced to the Labyrinth
• Princess Ariadne gives Theseus a string to trace his path and tells him the way to escape the Labyrinth
• Theseus makes promises to the 14 youths and maidens
• The Minotaur is defeated by Theseus
• Jason goes on a quest to retrieve the Golden Fleece, aided by the goddess Hera
• Jason encounters many challenges along the way, including the loss of his lover Hylas to the Nymphs and a battle against the army of warriors born from dragon's teeth
• Medea, a sorceress, helps Jason by giving him magic to defeat the challenges
• Medea kills her own brother and causes violence against her family
• Jason successfully retrieves the Golden Fleece and returns to Greece, where he faces challenges from King Pelias
• Medea is sought after by King Pelias' son and she takes violent measures to protect herself and Jason
• The Argonauts pass the Caucasus Mountains and free Prometheus
• The crew of the Argonauts encounters the dangers of Scylla and Charybdis and the Sirens
• Peleus marries Thetis and they have a son, Achilles
• Talos, a bronze monster, is defeated by Jason with the help of Medea
• When the Argonauts return to Greece, Pelias tells them that Jason's parents are dead, but he plans to kill Jason
• Theseus kills the Minotaur
